Posts.Content: Hi juley 68 i has 5 Dosetaxel ( didn’t manage the 6th) I found going for a walk helped . On days I felt yucky I was much better going out somewhere a run in the car ( with hubby or a friend as I stopped driving while on chemo as with chemo I got floaty head now and again ) with a wee walk and a cup of tea somewhere . Keep on top of pain by taking paracetamol as packet says , take first half an hour before you get up. It wasn’t too bad .  You MIGHT experience other side effects but we will not go into them for now and don’t go looking for them !  After 3rd Dosetaxel I was admitted to hospital with a high temp and no immunity! But I was having a great day and feeling on top of the world !!!  Even had a wee glass of wine with dinner then later got shivery and noticed my face was red ! Yip I had a temp . So watch your temperature, I was told Dosetaxel is a very good chemo but strong !   Only my 5th Dosetaxel caused me any real problem .  Read my profile .  Plus dontvself medicate - tell your chemo team EVERY if any  problem you have . Don’t mess about , if you need laxatives , they will give you the best , same with mouth wash etc  Hope all goes well and let your friends be good to you and take you out x Ruby Rose xx
Posts.Title: Side effefts

Posts.Content: Hi fannygash personally I wouldn’t go abroad . Infact during chemo I only travelled an hour an a half circumference of hospital ( that’s how far I live from hospital ) . We went to some lovely hotels etc , but I know Hotels aren’t always recommended while in Chemo due to contacting germs from others . Infact I was told to avoid small compact areas and chose large airy garden centres to meet friends for coffee .  I don’t think you would enjoy your holiday - it’s not the same , we jumped on a plane before my mastectomy, just to get away from IT ALL !! Ok it was nice but the worry and concerns follow you , ok we had time to ourselves and shed tears but we could have done that nearer home . A luxury caravan / lodge for instance. Without the worry of what if I get ill ?, when will I be fit to travel home ?  I was admitted after  chemo 2 or 3 ( can’t remember now !) I felt great , looked great but I had a high temperature and was out in isolation for five days . Don’t think any insurance would cover you for that .  So treat yourselves nearer home , be good to yourself , the holidays abroad will come , you will enjoy them but even those will be emotional .  Dont invite risk - stay safe xxx love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: chemo & travel

Posts.Content: Hi ,  early days for me but does anyone have any tips to relieve peripheral neuropathy, having s day out today with family and want to last the day .  Seeing oncologist in 2 weeks , last chemo was permanently cancelled due to this .  Thanks  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy relief ?

Posts.Content: Thanks moomy  on bus Home , I took it easy and we had s good day . I will ask about the vitamin B12 ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy relief ?

Posts.Content: Hi Winky49 any chance of working from home ? Even if you need to go into the office to collect work .  Good luck  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Dear Shieldscannylass You really shouldn’t have to put up with side effects . Pity it’s fruday and the chemo unit you use might be closed for weekend . If you get side effects you should phone your team , who will advise you of what to do ,  a) ask you to come in so they can check you and give you meds  b) tell you to go to your GP c) advise you if over the counter meds  if they are closed then your next move would be your pharmacist as there are mouth washes , gels etc they can give you. BUT as to speak to the pharmacist , tell them discreetly that you are a Cancer Patient .  Please don’t suffer , I was given lots of medication for moth ulcers and got very quick relief but all prescription.  You are suffering a lot with the cancer , so do not hesitate to ask your team . They have lotions and potions for most side effects .  Sorry not much help.  Take good care of yourself  love  Ruby Rose   Nurses are nurses because they care , let them care for you xx
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Dear Shieldscannylass just read your profile , I hope you are getting help with the loneliness , so sad as there will be lots of others who are lonely too. Have you spoken to anyone about this ? Is there a Maggies centre near you that could help ? Speak to your GP as we have a Macmillan centre near me but you need a referral . Also Breast Cancer Care have a helpline and meetings too plus they have a “ someone like me “ service .  I hope you have a good weekend . I’m well , just waiting on my first mammogram! Very scary! It’s the waiting for the results that’s the worst bit .  Take care and look after yourself . Get plenty of rest . I’m off to do my jigsaw , I do one most weeks , I buy from charity shops .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Pesky mouth ulcers driving me crazy

Posts.Content: Phone your Oncologists secretary , they are usually very very understanding and helpful and will pass a message to your oncologist who will get in touch with you . Hospital switch hboatd will put you through or you cancer day unit .  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Taking the pill after cancer?

Posts.Content: Dear AnnJac, i  am in away was lucky the decision was made for me . I didn’t get my 6th chemo due to peripheral neuropathy etc . I’m so glad as I still have the side effects  5 months down the line. but manageable. I’m not making light of it , the missing chemo will bother you ,no matter how much sense stopping makes . I feel I failed but that’s silly and I have been assured it won’t make any difference. I think tears and December go together . EVERYONE has memories of Decembers past . My hubby put up our tree , so that I wouldn’t flood the place with my tears .  Take care  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Dear Coley1993 please call your team , I was always petrified of being sick and told anesthetist before my mastectomy, she gave me great drugs to combat sickness , I never felt sick or was sick . I was given a 5 day delayed action anti sickness pill , so sorry I can’t remember what it was called . But phone and request something like that , I was given the tablet just before my chemo .  I had very bad side effects from Dosetaxel- peripheral neuropathy being the worst , that chemo was stopped after 5 . I was told it would make no difference to my outcome to miss one . I really was too poorly .  So please ask for better anti sickness meds . Do you remember to drink 3 litres the first 3 days and 2 litres every day after . Makes a huge difference but can be hard ifvtaste buds go peculiar!! you can also ask for chemo to be reduced - I did and they were going to reduce to 90% but my side effects became too debilitating and chemo was stopped.  So phone and request anti sickness and then phone day before chemo to make sure they are in hand and all organised for you . - it’s your body , your health , you won’t forget about you but unfortunately others can ! Don’t be affraid to keep asking - this advise was given to me by an old family doctor !  Good luck  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Traveltripper yes my tastebuds came back quite quickly ! Need to look at my diet  after new year !!  I didn’t know about constipation with the anti nausea as only ever got the pill in hospital , so no slip to read but I did suffer from constipation  etc but put it all down to Dosetaxel.  So good advise to get medication in place for that too .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Janet12  I have been in hospital many times as have friends , ours is a very large teaching hospital . Never heard of belongings going missing . My phone etc were locked in a medicin safe above my bed . iI could have given to staff for safe keeping .  I just spoke to my son , a student nurse . He has never heard it being an ussue . He says that each ward has a safe and money , keys , phones etc can be deposited and you will sign a ward register . Very secure . Just be sensible and don’t leave belongings on show .  You should always give a trusted friend a key for emergencies ( as you live alone ) The Hospital will ask for your next of kin and you could also give them your friends number as a contact .  Now is the time you will need friends , even if you are a very private person . There will be someone who will be happy to help you , people say “ ask if you need help” so ask , you will be surprised by the number of good people there is in this world but also the ones we think will be good , will hide !!! Try not to stress about this and as suggested please express your concerns to your breast care nurse /team .  Lots of love and hugs  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Going into hospital

Posts.Content: Happy Easter Pringle68, i would say to be guided by your breast nurse , also try somewhere like Insurewith just to see if you can get insurance ( of course you may have already bought insurance ) but this would give you an idea if they would insure you as a new customer , would give you an idea of how they would assess your risk.  I had DIEP and everything was text book , but I had to have chemo after 6 weeks. Do you need any further treatment Chemo or Radiotherapy?  Remember some further treatments are decided once the pathology comes back and that can take 2-3 weeks and you would not probably advised until you follow up appointment at about 5/6 weeks.  If you cancel now , will you get your money back ? If you do, I think I would cancel , it’s a big operation and a brilliant one. But it comes with risks and depending if you have your lymph nodes removed too . If you were going on a luxury holiday nearer home I would probably say go for it . Why not phone your breast care nurse /team or your surgeons secretary .  Their secretaries are usually brilliant at helping .  What does your “gut” say ? Usually a good guide .  Good luck with the decision ,. Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi - just ordinary Nail Polish and ones marked gel but don’t need cured by light NOT gel that’s needs cured. I put a base coat of nail strengthener on first and I also use a top coat as lasts longer . I always had strengthener , then black, then any colour that I liked , sometime a glitter coat then a top coat . I used to put on in the evening or even at bedtime as I’m so impatient and during the day I would rush it and smudge it!  I buy from boots , Tesco and the original factory shop bargains . Buy quick dry ones . You will also need remover and pads .  Be daring !  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Confused... light or dark nail varnish during chemo?

Posts.Content: SOME of my collection !!!
Posts.Title: Confused... light or dark nail varnish during chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Bejoy , Claudia  once you start chemo , just get a file and polish , no pushing of cuticles etc , you don’t want to invite infection during chemo when your immune system can be comprised. But get the full works before you start . Love Lorna   Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Confused... light or dark nail varnish during chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Beachwalker19,  definately dark - following female oncologists advise , I treated myself every three weeks , the day before chemo . Black nail polish on fingers and toes then Sometime I would have other colours put in top . I had Troll stickers , flower stickers etc applied too then a top coat to keep longer . I would also buy a colour similar to what beautician had applied , so that I could top up. I also found any polish with glitter in it lasted longer too.  I now have a vast array of polish ! I do them myself now as the girl who did mine is now battling breast cancer too !! never lost a finger nail , 6 months on and my nails are getting healthy again , I had a ridge in each finger nail for each chemo I had ! All grown out now . I did loose a big toe nail but there was a new one half grown under it .  Still do my nails , Love all the colours and sparkles . I also applied cuticle oil through out treatment . so if anyone wants to treat you - manicure , pedicure , or file and polish , buy you nail polish etc . Or ask them to do it for you .   Wishing you well Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Confused... light or dark nail varnish during chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Pringle68 me again !!! I have insurance through the bank, it’s in with the type of account I have - they will not cover anything to do with my breast cancer ! Now I have completed treatment they say they will cover me but not my breast cancer - I said I don’t have breast cancer  anymore - they say that’s fine . BUT I still went to INSUREWITH as I wouldn’t trust the insurance , if , say I got a blood clot - I’m sure they would say it was related to my surgery . INSUREWITH only charged me £28 .  Maggies centre gave me a list of insurance companies . you can have a lovely holiday here in the uk . While having chemo , we had nice long weekends away , just an hour from home .  We went to Tenerife last minute before my operation , very stressful and they had a storm the day we were coming home and they closed the airport and we had to stay another night ! I was due to get scans ! made them with 30 minutes to spare! Wouldn’t recommend   Treat yourself to nice things .  Take care  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi all , I was talking to a knowledgeable friend yesterday about my thin patch on top , due to chemo , I know it will get thicker  but I’ve always been a wee bit thin there . She said that ladies who have polycyclic overies  can get REGAIN on prescription. Worth asking your GP as hair loss can cause Depression etc .  I’m just being patient as it’s early days for me and I do have a good head of hair , just a wee bit thin .  Good luck and ask about a prescription . They can only say no or hopefully yes .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Letrozole - hair thinning

Posts.Content: Hi Raychw, we are all different , but personally I would stay and get all the rest I could , take enough clothes etc to stay a few days and you can always change your mind . I had immediate reconstruction and was kept in for 7 days but was also offered to stay longer but as my son was leaving , I wanted an evening at home with him and his dad . Be kind and good to yourself.  Love  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy op help

Posts.Content: Hi , I was discovered to have  a heart murmur at my first oncology appointment and my treatment plan was changed to suit my health . So don’t worry they will change  your treatment to suit your new health issues .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Problem with heart halfway through Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Well done !! Chill out this weekend xx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Dear NikkiT1204  I blubbered away on the phone and they were great ! As someone on here said -tears are the soap  for the soul !  I am doing really well ( still have my moments and probably always will )  off to Lanzarote next Saturday , like a miracle, on the 3rd January this year , I thought my life was over ! Seems a million years ago . Not been easy but I got there . You will too.  Still got challenges but loving life .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Hi shefka ,  I had my first chemo  about 6 weeks after my mx (I had 30 lymph nodes removed , 3 were infected) . One week later I found a lump on my arm and I called the chemo help line and they weren’t concerned. I was worried and asked if I could go to the hospital and have it checked. I had it checked and they said it was a reactive node and it would disappear and it did but took about 3 weeks . Never seen again. Never gave me any bother either . hope yours turns out the same.    Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Reactive lymph node after sentinel node removed

Posts.Content: Hi NikkiT204 mmm what a worry for you ! Only my early cancer and One lymph node showed up on mammogram and MRI , the couldn’t find the actual cancer tumour until I had my mastectomy and was found in pathology - all good and every thing removed , although only 1 lymph node had shown they took all of mine , think 30 and three were infected . I have had no problems . Thought I was getting lymphodema but it was a side effect of the Chemo I got and all settled now .  Tough one for you . I would phone the Macmillan nurses on here on Monday , they are great and so knowledgeable. It will still be your decision but a more informed one . Breast Cancer Care helpline is open on a Saturday morning and they too are great. I too have had questions I needed answers too - mine was about me getting reduced  Herceptin and the nurses on line were able to give me a better understanding of where my consultants were coming from .  Hope you get some carity  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Wasfit@50 your Boob will get a million times better when chemo over , in about 5 weeks you will notice big difference in comfort .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Found in lymph nodes following Wle

Posts.Content: Bobbie_57 i think you are NORMAL because that’s how I feel too !!! I’m determined to be NORMAL  - Crazy but normal I have my review on the 28th then a mammogram of my “good” breast and it better be good !  I’m  attending Breast Cancer Care -Moving Forward Course , which is 4 thursdays in February , infact the last one is on the morning of my annual review !!  It is so hard not to worry , but try not to waste our precious days worrying about what might never happen . If we waste our days worrying , then “C” wins !!!  Listen to me being the big brave one !!! That’s whats is great about this forum , when someone is down there is always someone up and offering a helping hand to pull you up - it’s called the hand of friendship. Xx off to dreamland now .  Sweetdreams  love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Feeling sad

Posts.Content: Hi Kelly38 i wore the cold cap , I didn’t find it bad at all. I took paracetamol with me and asked the nurse when to take it , usually 15 minutes before the plugged it in . I was also given a nice hot cup of tea to hug and drink . After 15 minutes you don’t know you have it on . I also took a flask if coffee as sometimes they are so busy and a hot drink does help stops you getting cold , also a couple of light weight fleece blankets with me , to keep cosy ( hospital gave me a blanket too) just watch the tube at the back goes over the back if your seat NOT next to your back . Brrr if you need to go to the toilet they just unplug you and you push your drip to the ladies .  My chemotherapy was Dosetaxel and I was told it had a good success rate with cold cap . My hair bit thin on top after chemo had finished but started to grow back quickly . I’m 63 and my hair was a wee bit thin on top before treatment .  I did NOT find it painful .  Ask your chemo nurse / oncologist if it’s worth trying , they will be honest - or try it and see.  Wishing you well with your chemo , it’s not the best but very doable ,  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Cold Cap - is it worth trying with AC Chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Jane26, i go to aqua aerobics and I love it , great fun and the water supports you . I wear a bra under my swimsuit , black bra and black swimsuit and no one notices , I have noticed some of the larger busted ladies do this too.  We have a great laugh and it’s therapy for the body and soul plus coffee after .  I get a discount as I have self referred on medical grounds - so worth doing , only for three months though.  I find it helps my hands and feet , I have peripheral neuropathy.  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Exercising after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi , i had my single mastectomy and DIEP reconstruction on 6th March , everything was text book and I had no problems . I was considered fit to start Chemo on the 13th April , that’s 5 and a half weeks .  I was walking on the beach in Scotland on the 1st April but taking it easy .   Are you holidaying in Britain or abroad . ?  If abroad I would definitely ask your specialist plastic surgery nurse .  You MUST keep on your surgical stockings 24/7 give or take an hour for 6 weeks.  So ask your team and go with what they say - they want to look after you not ruin holidays but will give your their professional advice . good luck  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Diep recovery

Posts.Content: Hi , I’m still waiting for all my biopsy results , the waiting is the worst but in the meantime I wanted to find out as much information as I could . I don’t know if I will get a mastectomy, but I visited a local underwear shop and had a lovely chat with the lady owner she showed me s catalogue of underwear that would be suitable and I was surprised how pretty they were . She also told me that 70% of her ladies didn’t get reconstruction and were happy and confident . She also says some bought private prosthesis although nhs were ok they said private ones were nicer , but only a personal preference. I found all the knowledge very comforting . wishing you well with your decisions  Ruby xx
Posts.Title: Struggling to decide about reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi ejm1  i am getting a 3D nipple tattoo and I have already had two applications but as it’s a medical tattoo it fades but I’m told in the end it will be very effective and just need topped up annually.  It realy is effective and I’m very pleased . No pain but the give you cream to apply an hour before - just incase .  I would recommend getting the NHS medical tattoo then if you want to get it touched  up more permanently at a regular tattooist .  I didn’t have radiotherapy but I did have chemo . My mastectomy was 6 th March 2018 , so just about a year .  Wushing you well  Ruby Rose.
Posts.Title: mastectomy tattoo anyone ?

Posts.Content: Sorry just read this ,  not  too sure about nipple recon , One of the nurses had got tattoo first then recon and I just thought - yip I’ll try that . Im happy and remember it’s painless . I might get a commercial tattoo done one day in the future  . But the nurse who does the tattoos said lots of ladies don’t actuslly need to come back for a top up , but they do as a sort of comfort and contact with the hospital .  I must say my tattoo is very effective .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: mastectomy tattoo anyone ?

Posts.Content: Hi Luthien i am exhausted reading what you have been up to !!! Great you have had the energy , I didn’t get radiotherapy but friends have , some got very fatigued, others not so bad . I would definitely check out parking near the station , just incase the fatigue catches up on you - be prepared . Darker nights now too.  Mom a Scottish country girl but I love London and the hustle and bustle but I always avoided the rush hours when visiting my son and traveling into the city - that was me well too.  You have a wonderful spirit ! Well done you , keep the fun in your days x Take Care  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: i still can’t get it out of my head that I’m not getting the full treatment!  Due to pre existing heart murmur I am only getting 6 Herceptin injections ! 6 x Dosetaxel- due to get last one next week .  I have already spoken to my oncologist about being unhappy and worried and she explained the reasons . my heart , told no point in being cancer free and confined to a wheelchair with heart failure !  Ive never seen a cardiologist  re my cancer diagnosis/ treatment . Only had 1 echocardiogram. No scans planned. What do I do ? Told nurses my fears and they say to go back to oncologist BUT they are not very approachable and took offence when I last questioned .  I don’t want someone to say - give her what she wants ! I want reassured that the plan I’m on is in fact the best for me .  What to do ?  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Still worried !

Posts.Content: Hi maggiemee , and Leolady56 thanks for the hugs , I’ve spoken to Macmillan and I’m much more content now. I am going to ask my oncologist for help and advise to accept what I now believe to be the correct treatment plan . This way they will know how I feel without questioning their decision , which if I’m honest,  is I believe the correct one . What I want is someone else to say they totally agree with my treatment plan and all will be well - Big ask ! And not going to happen as this is crystal ball stuff . It’s funny when we start on the treatment journey we are full,of fear and hope , when we near the end of the treatment journey the fear of the unknown is quite overwhelming .Friends also battling cancer ( in other forms) have told me about getting a gym prescription from my doctor - once I am over the final chemo - and ready to get well . I can go to our sports centre and get fit with a tailored regime for me. Plus water aerobics will be back on the agenda - again suited to my age and fitness.  So I have to learn to enjoy each day as it comes and not worry about my cancer coming back .  I think someone referred my post to Macmillan and for this I am so grateful , I got an email that they were concerned and asking me to phone etc . What a wonderful service .  Feelling happier Ruby Rose xxx
Posts.Title: Still worried !

Posts.Content: Hi SunshineKidddd,  yes January 2018 was the month my world fell apart too ! But we are here and we are fighting . My annual check up is March - 12 months since mastectomy. Then hopefully get on with the next 11 months ( till next check up) going to pack as much as I can into it . One thing this experience teaches us - live life to the full , live it now and enjoy as best we can . Surround ourselves with good friends and family , positive , caring ones .  Lots of love  Ruby Rose xx
Posts.Title: A year

Posts.Content: Hi Mary4  i had 5 Dosetaxel, I actually found going out with my husband or a friend helped my aches . We would go somewhere in the car for a bit if lunch or coffee , maybe walk round a few shops . It really helped . I didn’t go out alone while I wasn’t 100% , I did have peripheral neuropathy and still do 5 months down the line but getting better . But I wasn’t bad till the 5th Dosetaxel.  Once feeling better , I had a day out then a day in . Worked for me .  In  this cold weather , a cosy few hours in bed won’t do any harm but company is good ( in bed or out of it )  love  Ruby Rose

MRI to pin point true cancer True cancer pinpointed Going this week for ultra sound and they are going to try and biopsy and get true cancer cells . But I had two sections to deliver my sons 30 plus years ago and the scar is up and down. So probably they won’t be able to use that fat . Posts.Title: Early cancer plus cancer plus 1 x lymph node treatment— lumpectomy...

Posts.Content: Dear Henty what you are feeling is perfectly normal , it’s such a shock . Also you will read some posts and wonder what all the terminology is . Just take your time and ask on here and we will help .  Your life is NOT over ! But it will be different . I have to think back to last year to remind myself of all that happened , honestly I’m well , ok I now have white hair but it’s so thick and in brilliant condition and much admired . I’m happy .  I think everyone will agree that once you get your treatment plan it gets easier in a way . You know what’s going to happen , you will be looked after by some incredible nurses and doctors .  Its just a shock and we all handle it differently. But handle it we do . The main person in all of this is you and now you must learn to put you first .  This is a brilliant site and everyone on here has supported me through it all . They will support you too .  Take care  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed terrified. Feel like life is over.

Posts.Content: OOOOOO this is getting exciting ! I will wait till new year and see what month , city etc suits us the most and or we can have 2 meet ups
Posts.Title: 2019 Meet up in Scotland ? Anyone ?

Posts.Content: Hi Mary4  Hope you can manage tomorrow Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: 2019 Meet up in Scotland ? Anyone ?

Posts.Content: Good Morning Frilly Flower ,  first diagnosed 3/1/18  i was a bit like you in the beginning , I was diagnosed after routine screening , I had no symptoms. I too was told various diagnosis to begin with . But as more tests done different things came to light . ALL TREATABLE !!  The first lesson we all must learn on this journey - ALWAYS  carry a wee notebook and write down all the questions you want to ask - either at appointments or my telephone to your team . My hospital dont allocate a specific breast care nurse as they are alllivrly and work as a team , this way if someone is on holiday , I’ll or at another clinic YOU will always get someone to speak too.  The next lesson is WAITING the most cruel lesson we need to learn but pathology takes time to culture cells etc in labs .  Yet another lesson and the hardest for me , stop trying to plan your life as before as life is changing and not for the worst- we learn what is most precious to us and take each day or appointment to appointment as it comes .  I went from being an early cancer being treated by lumpectomy , followed by radiotherapy. I ended up with left side mastectomy with immediate DIEP reconstruction , purely because I had lots of tiny pre cancerous cells and one small tumour but spread to lymph nodes . They removed 32 lymth nodes but only 3 with cancer . My operation was frightening to think of and I wanted to run away but it was so successful and once I get my 3D nipple tattoo next year , no one will notice the difference. As my husband says - it’s amazing !  The next shock for me was I had to get Chemo but not Radiotherapy ( who knows that could change ) because I have a heart murmur I’m getting a different chemo plan - every treatment is individual to each patient - IT IS NOT ONE SIZE FITS ALL!  You are an individual and will be treated as one . My Chemo is going well and no great difficulties ( yet) . Every one says I’m amazing which is so good for my confidence. I made up my mind after the first two months of crying every day ( in the shower - very therapeutic) . That when I looked in the mirror , my face looked better with a smile than when greetin!!! So smiley face it is .  Even now I have more questions to ask and I am phoning my oncologists secretary on Monday to ask the questions and I don’t mind a reply by phone or by appointment .  If you read my profile ( flower) and you can see my posts if you scroll down . It’s been an emotional roller coaster but we are fighters and fight we will .  My oncologist nearly jumped out of her seat when my eldest son asked if everything was positive and she said Oooo YES YES  very positive .  I have been very open with all my friends and they have all been fantastic , some special  ones have actually come out if the woodwork if you know what I mean , my house has been like a florists for months . You will find the special friends that you can shed a tear with . My hubby has been brilliant but sometime i want to cry and feel better instantly but he keeps feeling sad for days after we have a joint cry . Just a learning process all round .  The journey ahead will not be easy emotionally but definitely character building .    Just be prepared for anything and everyone on this community has been BRILLIANT, so supportive when I have had bad, sad times and seeking advise on everything , even about is it ok to take a holiday , brilliant tips for operations , managing ANY - IF ANY side effects of treatment but as my nurse said - HEY YOU DONT GO LOOKING FOR THEM !! We have a laugh.  We cancer warriors have a good laugh most days as it beats  crying !  I hope I haven’t frightened you , but just to reassure you that EVERY EMOTION That you feel - fear , anger, sadness, bewilderment, is normal . DO NOT GOOGLE . Stick to this community and you won’t go wrong . YOU WILL HAVE HAPPY DAYS.  Love and hugs  Ruby Rose xxx

Posts.Content: Hi Frillyflower I go to the Maggies Centre at Ninewells Hospital Dundee and they are great, you just pop in although I did telephone them and they looked out for me . I went myself the first time and they were lovely and I chatted and cried and was cared for. Next time took my hubby under the pretext of wanting a nice relaxing cuppa and knowing that someone would chat to him too. Not all the surgeons spoke to him, he felt a bit miffed! But at Maggies it was very casual over a cuppa. I asked for counselling but men being men , my hubby said he was fine !! But every time we have gone back for a nice cuppa as we are early for my appointments , they always speak to him. I’m in a happier place now and only needed the one counselling session but I also know that if I want more I will be seen very quickly as I’m in the system. ( I also lost my 88 year old Mum during all this and I was her carer] . I’m a bit far away - 1 hr drive from Maggies , so haven’t been to yoga or anything yet but I’m booked for the feel good session with make up and goodie bags etc. Plus my employer not playing the game , so speaking to  Macmillan CAB adviser at Maggies.  Yes definitely pay a visit. Lovely place, Lovely people.  Hugs  Ruby Rose xx

Posts.Content: Hi AnnJac  i didn’t buy front fastening , I was advised to buy back fastening but also to buy bra extenders . I bought sports bras from Tesco - easy to return if not needed . Bra extenders from sewing   / hobby shops , also good bra shops stock them  yes you will have a catheter ( thank goodness)  I was in hospital gowns for 3 days then I wore front opening night shirt types - roomy ones . Also I liked soft fleecy type pjs with shirt style top . Big with waist to below boobs ( he he )? Yes I would recommend blouses and cardigans .  Lots of pillows , I was given a heart shaped one by hospital , to put under my arm for journey home . First night home I slept on our recliner . Then I was ok in bed but lots of soft pillows , lots of trying to get comfy . BUT NOT SORE !  You will get advise re exercises in hospital , when moving up the bed - bend your knees , dig your heels in and push from heels . Try standing up straight as soon as you can , bottom in and shoulders back ( I had two sections when I had my children - 100 years ago )   If you stoop too much you will get a sore back .  Yes a week will be good , get him to take you a little walk every day - 15- 39 mins - slow walk , you will feel the benefit but not of course if it’s icy ! Let him spoil you .  I wore light support pants and leggings .  My surgery and recovery were text book  no problems .  Be warned :- you may have a melt down ! I did - well I was petrified !! But I ranted  that I wasn’t going while packing !! My son told the anesthetist all my fears - being sick , not waking up again ,  mainly being sick . She prescribed me a different cocktail and reassured me that I would wake up . She prescribed me a tablet for bedtime and I slept till they woke me to go to theatre . Yes I did wake up and NO PAIN, NO SICKNESS - in the morning I sent hubby a selfie !!  Day 2 or was it 3 - I cried most if the day and seems that’s normal after all the trauma , anaesthetics etc .  Once  home I must admit I didn’t like to look in the mirror , I covered my bedroom one ! I couldn’t check myself !!so I asked if a district nurse could call and they were only too delighted . All was well . One day I came out of the shower room and hubby was hovering ( like my shadow ) I always had a wee cry in the shower , so came  out and said / shouted - I suppose you want a look ?!!! Threw open the towel and he just went quiet then said whow!!! Your perfect , all amazing and he just stared - wee bit too long - so that’s when I looked in the mirror properly and yes it was great but I cried and he cuddled me .  So all good and you will just need paracetamol and maybe a codein if your going out to lunch etc .renember if someone asks to take you out say - yes please . You can’t drive for 6 weeks . I also asked to see a physiotherapist, my gp said they didn’t ysysky do that but I said I would like to see one , she was great and made sure I was doing my exercises properly and actually gave me more. I did feel some cursing and it is so important to keep doing your exercises and massaging your breasts . I massaged using E45 emollient wash , while in the shower , I used E45 cream all over my boddy , hubby has continued helping me ( commonly known as milking it ) also Aveeno cream is lovely too . Love getting my back done!  Well I better shut up now !!!  I am getting my 3D Tattoo started next week Good luck and hope all goes smoothly - your getting a bigger op than me - I didn’t need the reduction .  Lots of love  if I’ve missed anything , just ask ruby rose

Posts.Content: Hi FrillyFlower  Tea and toast parties at 3am ( if you have a partner ) are healthier than meds , I also record programs like emmerday and coronation street etc and get up for half an hour and watch it , then Back to bed and sleep , better than fight8ng it. Keep a note book handy by your bed as sometimes you think of things , once you write them down it’s leaves that box ticked in your mind.  On the subject of private health my consultants , Breast, Plastic and oncologist all said it can take a lot longer to get diagnosis and treatment than on NHS , they tend to have to use NHS for treatment unless you live in a very large city with large private hospitals. But I do know a friend who went private for a second opinion who just confirmed what NHS consultant had said. Of course you may get different medication that NHS can’t pay for , so I wouldn’t rul it out . Maybe as you say go to NHS and tell them that you have private medical cover and ask if there are any medication that NHS can’t pay for due to government restrictions ( be diplomatic ) . Good luck and polish your smiley face , keep asking us questions. We will hold your hand through this.  Love  Ruby Rose xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Littleone 31 I’m getting Docetaxel only plus Herceptin.  Docetaxel - the T in FEC T  Has a good success rate of less hair loss when wearing the cold cap . Nothing is guaranteed though and I figured if I keep half my hair then I would only have half to grow again .  Before my chemo I busied myself and went shopping for my wig and laid one aside . I love it and everyone thinks I have just had my hair done !  I’ve had 2 chemo and I still have my hair - ok I shed some when I wash it - only once a week and very gently . But it’s dyill ok .  Cold cap is very do able - paracetamol 20 minutes before they put in on me And a hot cuppa at the ready , after 10 minutes all ok . I take lots of cosy fleece blankets to keep cosy . I’m fine .  I hope this helps but it all depends what chemo. You get.  Take care  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: How many cycles of chemo before total hair loss?

Posts.Content: Hi  I’m so sorry you are all having a hard time . I have been like your Mum but only in melt down moments - I said things that hurt my family so much but at the time that was how I honestly felt .  My elder son in a very analytical manner told me what I was doing to both sons and my husband . Did I honestly want their last memory of me as being some out of control sobbing woman , spouting mad ness ? Would it help if we sat down together and planned my funeral to the very last moment ? In fact did I have a day in mind ?!! He told me I should just pack in the treatment and let the cancer rampage through my body and they - who love me dearly - would have to stand back and watch because what was the point of going to appointments if I didn’t believe ANYONE?! He then handed me a list of phone numbers , Macmillan , Breast Cancer Care , the Samaratins , Maggies and Breast care nurses .  He said when I’ve made up my mind , just let us know , we can get the funeral director round to discuss things or we can all sit and have a cup of tea and watch a film or cuddle or cry or laugh or go for a walk or just do everything except the undertaker ., they want to help me and fight with me but they can only take so much cruelty as this is real life and they need to work to pay bills which they couldn’t do if I shut them out and gave them all this extra worry. They said I didn’t choose to be Sick , it’s not my fault , I’m not a failure ( sorry but I will always feel one but keep that to myself) don’t let Cancer win !  Well ,  I say these feelings only lasted for a few hours iof meltdowns . Thankfully only twice with a mini third one !  Hard to know if the straight talking approach would work in your situation . But you Mum is robbing you all of happy times  and so cruel on the grand children too.  I offered my husband a divorce ! 43 years we have been married - I said - you can go and get yourself a blonde!!! Well he has ! As I can’t dye my hair anymore and I’m now blonde/white and after DIEP remodelled figure  . It’s an I’ll wind that blows no good .  But depression is an awful thing - I experienced it once when I was in a job that I hated - blackness that’s all I could see - awful and I never understood what depression could me like until then but I was easy cured - moved job !  Thinking about you all , just have lots of hugs and don’t ask to visit - just do it . I don’t think she would reject the grandchildren if they came to visit with sweets and cakes - maybe not flowers as she might think she is dying. ( we all are , nothing surer but not today if we can help it )  read my profile  off to hug hubby xxx love  Ruby Rose

Posts.Content: Hi SarahS Ask your Oncologist for a referral to a dietician ,tell them you need to be proactive !  i have friends over the years who are  dieticians , they are very passionate about their profession and would love to help you . That would be a starting block . Local farmers markets could be good too , although they can be expensive . Health food shops like Holland and Barrat could be good too .  Make yourself a wee card on it write - I am a cancer patient . you may not want to repeat that verbally.  say you need advice to self help.  Wishing you well i get no.5 chemo of 6 today , managing fine love  Ruby Rose

Posts.Content: Hi Beedeb  The best advice I can give you and your mum is the you MUST phone the number that her team will have given you both . Remember they are working and waiting to help you and wanting to help you .  They may email a prescription to a local pharmacy , they may want your mum to go to hospital , they may say to go to your GP but it’s a holiday weekend . So if concerned in the slightest please phone them. No one wants your mum to suffer .  There is a thread - May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club which is very useful to read and post on .  Also you can search for Breast Cancer Chemo Tips .  Hope this helps but never be afraid to ask your mums team , they are best placed to help, even if the out of hours number says it’s for emergency , please phone them and they will give you advise to access help.  Love Ruby Rose xx

Posts.Content: Hi all ,    I just posted this in wrong thread !!! Copied over !  my walk today was round the loft !!! Don’t worry we have an excellent fixed loft ladder . Lots of empty boxes kept incase items had to be returned within warranty time ! Lots to skip . Then to toys ! My sons are 36 and 39 and I was a childminder for years so kept all the toys for grandchildren - mmmm both sons still single and I think I may be jinxing things by keeping all the toys . But been ndy for when my nephew visits from Canterbury but he’s 11 now !! So I’ll keep all  the Lego from 1 to 100 years . Girl over road starting childminding - mmm very handy , just took over books and games plus microscope for her elder son .  With my peripheral neuropathy bad in my feet , I feel I’ve walked miles .  Oncologist appointment in the morning at 11.15   plus fasting bloods at 10.15 - I’ll be starving ! I’m taking part in add aspirin trial . See what transpired .  But im knackered .  Must get a fit bit and start walking but aqua aerobics are great for me just now . Funny we “run” in the water round the pool the she says turn but with the waves we make it’s hard going fighting them. Great exercise for the facial cheeks - so much laughter .  See what Oncologist says tomorrow and if I’m getting pills to take !  Hapoy walking and hope to join in soon - once loft clear !  Love  Ruby Rose xx My face looks better when I smile - so smile it is !
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi moony youhave probably done this but just incase — I had to stop carrying a handbag of any description! When I carry a bag I get hip pain ! Not too bad if I have in a rucksack . If I go a walk I like to take a few things in my pockets only and no pain . Thanks for  your lovely comments  when my younger son worked in London , we went on the DLR - found it scary lol ! Country folk in London is scary full stop! He once lived in Greenwich and it was very nice , loved Clapham and Brixton- loved the hustle and bustle and I found Londoners friendly - IF I smiled . I got offered seats on the buses and on the tube . My son said the people were in shock at this smiling chatting Scottish person !  Smile and the world smiles with you . Hope all goes well for you and you get the cause of the pain  sorted .  Love  Ruby Rose x

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Amalie , he he - my 39 year old single son has just returned home after working in the south of England for 17 years ! Already has an honours degree and a Masters but even though he had a high flying very well paid job , he wanted a change !!! Well if they have to work to 70 I suppose they better be happy ! That’s him started a Masters in Adult Nursing! ! Back in his old room even though he could stay at my late mums flat , he wants to stay with us for now ! My latemums flat is FULL of the contents of his flat from down south ! Lets just say it’s been interesting- it’s a miracle that we have managed to live this long without his advise !!!! Lol!!. i can see us having more breaks away .  So you could look at moving now ! Somewhere with one bedroom near good B&Bs !  Its going to be an interesting 3 years ! But he may buy somewhere nearer Uni . Then we will visit him ! have to go now as need to wash kitchen floor as might not be up to his standard !! Ruby Rose xx  just a bit of fun xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Good morning everyone, lovely sunny day here on the East Coast of Scotland ! Very blustery ! Not looking forward to today , I am going to a close friends Mother’s funeral , she had a good life and died at 91 years , but it’s the first funeral I will have been too since my own mothers in April , when I had just had my first chemo . So going to emotional. Also I’m getting my nails done first thing - so far they are looking ok but I know I could still loose them , but the girl who does them has just been told they are positive that the breast lump she found is cancer , she had a biopsy but that didn’t go well and has to be repeated next week . Just brings all the emotions of those first weeks back . It’s all just happening to often now - soo sad but glad she had confided in me and I’m thankful that I have always been very cheery and positive when I’ve been getting my nails done ( day before chemo when we all usually feel good) so we will keep smiling and I’ll be there for her if she needs me , she has sisters and lots of friends .  Have a good day everyone and stay safe if your still experiencing high winds . Ruby Rose xx

I will try and attach photos . We walked for 2 miles .  My hair is very thin on top but starting to grow ! I didn’t loose any until after my chemo finished !!!  He he added last two for fun - drift wood , Serpent  and next one a Dragon ! love  Ruby Rose x

Walked back to car and Home !!  So I’ll let my fingers do the walking - doing my latest jigsaw !  Bought 8 wonderful 1000 piece jigsaws for £25 on facebay last week - that’ will keep me busy ! Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone ,  not doing a lot of walking but doing what I can ! Yesterday met an old friend visiting town from Orkney and had coffee and cake for 2 hours ! I did walk home on my own but between the peripheral neuropathy in my feet and my iffy eyesight , I felt a bit uncomfortable. Getting new glasses on thursday . The joys of treatment !!!  But !! Last night hubby and I went out ! Dinner with friends then a cabaret act at the Golf Club ( I’m a social member) 60s music and a wee bit comedy . We danced ! Met lots of nice people who said nice things to me . Lots of laughs and we got home after 12 midnight !! Brilliant ! Only down side is that everyone I know with cancer have lost their hair during chemo - ME? I’m loosing it now 8 weeks after , but I was very poorly with last chemo . Sons advice was - Mum just don’t stand under a spotlight and no one will see your shiny head !!! Gee thanks - the place was full of downlighters! Maybe time to wear wig more . I like it but I thought that was behind me !!  Anyway I digress !! No aqua aerobics in the morning as problems with the pool ? So will try a walk with hubby - to doctors for blood test - oooo excitement! Sleep well everyone Love Ruby Rose

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56 its FREEZING ! Icy  cold wind , can’t believe the change in temperature. Had a walk and cuppa with a friend . Going back out but puting  cosy clothes on and taking the car ! Well this girl can’t go to Tesco and come out with one thing !!!  Going to buy trousers as I need smaller size now ! But I’ve kept my bigger ones ! That would be tempting fate !  Byeee Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi All,  well now in Cardiff for a long weekend with our younger son . After the 10 hour , two changes train journey ! I feel fine . Had dinner out and a cocktail or two !  See how my stamina holds up , may need to stop and refuel in cake shops and or drink more cocktails! Probably walk miles too.!!  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Been Walking in the cloudy but warm Lanzarote! Like a dream ,  So everyone , don’t stop dreaming , dreams can come true .  I’m a bit emotional but very happy . 3rd January 2018 was the start of the nightmare but I’ve done it ! As best I can .  Emotional over the battle I have won so far and also as this is the first holiday that I can’t phone my mum to tell her about the hotel etc  but the sun just shone on our balcony . She knows x  enlarge photo and you can see the sea , from our balcony , everyithing between us and the sea is the hotel grounds  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: good luck with that ! rain and gales here - rain been battering off our windows all night . But tomorrow is a new day and yes the sun might shine   Sweet Dreams  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi All  hopeing to join this thread soon , going to easy aqua aerobics this afternoon , doctor told me to go and I loved it last week. Felt so good finishing the class ( dumbed down for me - no hand weights ) very tired after but a happy tired . Still suffering badly from peripheral neuropathy in my feet but managing to walk , just don’t know how far as toes get sore . So walking in  the pool is good and helping to get some stamina - not a lot but it’s a start .  Going to Aberdeen tomorrow , on the bus as it’s free . So some walking will be done but I’ll be looking for comfy seats  and I bet I fall asleep in cinema but nothing new there ! well must get ready , one good thing - I have a mega flat tummy and a lovely cleavage thanks to DIEP and my brilliant surgeon ! Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi ,  I am not going for the nipple reconstruction - been told if I change my mind , I can get later .  So I am  getting my 3D nipple tattoo - told I will get pain killer cream - just incase ! Don’t expect to get started until January . 3D tattoos  look very realistic I’m told .  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Breast tattoo

Posts.Content: Dear jazzaap Of course you should push for further tests - YOU are worried and YOU are the important person here . Have you spoken to a Macmillan nurse in this site ? If not please phone them , they are so knowledgable and will support you - give you facts and terminology to arm yourself for your visit to your GP . When my hubby was in his early 50s he had disabling hip pain and GP said he was too young for a hip replacement . Well I sent him back and he seen Gp again saying he couldn’t go home without s referral and that I - his wife - had said he should sit in the surgery all day if need be . He had further tests and his hip was bone on bone and yes he got his hip replacement. It’s your body and you know it best . If they don’t attend to you medically they will end up attending to you sychologicaly !!  So please speak to someone on this helpline then go back to your GP.  Good luck and let us know how you get on .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Bit annoyed about white spot on nipple and GP help

Posts.Content: Hi ash7 i attended a discussion group st my local Maggies Centre re the use of Melatonin to prevent peripheral neuropathy. i believe a trial has been applied for to begin 2019.i have peripheral neuropathy but the trial would be to use before and during chemo.  No mention of preventing recurrence .  Melatonin is only available on prescription.   Ruby Rose

I was told ok .  In your position I would definitely ask your team : BCN .  I would say getting  your family immunised would be a good move .  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Flu jabs - timing and family as well?

Posts.Content: Hi lindseybubbles  i see you haven’t filled in any of your profile . It would help to say how old you are and what area you live in . That way you will get a close fit buddies .  I have had a very similar experience to you , first oh it’s pre cancer , then told by surgeon there is no such thing in Breast cancer - you have early breast cancer . But as one lymph node had cancethey knew there was another tumour in my breast and couldn’t find with biopsy or MRI  so mastectomy it was . I will happily answer any questions but read my profile first . If your young then I’ll be an old woman to you love  Ruby Rose xx
Posts.Title: Looking for mastectomy buddy

Posts.Content: Dear lindsaybubbles  i was “ lucky” my breast surgeon just stated the facts - I had lots of small early cancer plus one reak cancer , also Dorward to lymph nodes . So he said we propose doing a left mastectomy with immediate reconstruction . Like you initially told lumpectomy and radiotherapy , but after reading in hear about several ladies getting a lumpectomy then as they didn’t get clear margins , having to go back for further surgery to get clear margins and some three times then a mastectomy ! i was relieved with my course of surgery . My plastic surgeon and specialist reconstruction nurse were brilliant . I had DIEP reconstruction - had a melt down on morning if admittance  but once I got to hospital I was still very tearful but everyone was great . Operation was long but I knew nothing but it’s hard on family . I  At my first checkup after op I was told  “we got all the cancer” those few words mean so much .  Since the cancer was also in 3 lymph nodes then I needed Chemo .to mop up any stray cells that might have gone walk about .  All finished now .  I have a son with a medical biological and genetic background and he was very blunt about what would happen to me if I didn’t go for surgery !  Phone the Macmillan nurse on the number on this site . I have phoned a couple of times and they are so knowledgeable and informative . They helped me consider my options . Im delighted with my surgery , my new breast is amazing . I know what the future may hold - one way or another but I know I have done everything to continue to smell the roses  for as long as is humanly possible  .  Lots of Love  Ruby Rose  Lorna x
Posts.Title: Looking for mastectomy buddy

Posts.Content: Hi Fonty55 thanjyiu very much for thinking about me xx Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Looking for mastectomy buddy

Posts.Content: Nurse called to say my mastectomy with lymph node removal and reconstruction will be early March . I have CT scan on 26th February . My husband just retired before my diagnosis and I have always said we would have lots of holiday !! So I come off phone with nurse and booked a holiday going Sunday and back 25th feb , pushing the boat out and getting a private transfer to the airport and on the return . Going to Tenerife to a lovely hotel we had been to before ( less stress ) But I’m so down - will this be our last holiday abroad ever ? Have any of you lovely Ladies been abroad after recovery , I know it will be at least a year . Or should I just be grateful for my life ? Ruby x

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzy4u, I would ask your specialist nurse , I met mine for pre assessment for admittance to hospital . Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: Dear Nicole 279 I have called the Macmillan nurse on the telephone number on here and they are brilliant to talk to . Also to nurse at Breast cancer care - google their number , also brilliant .  I have also been to the Maggies Centre , great for a chat .  I must admit I cried buckets !! But we are all different sndxa lady at my aqua aerobics class told me she never cried for weeks , her doctor ‍⚕️ and family were worried about her not crying ! She said she did cry eventually and felt better for it but I don’t think she cried often. Me ? I cried every day in the shower ! But I did have other sadness in my life .  I had good friends who I always spoke to and they were there  to listen and hug me when I need them . We now go shopping and drink prosecco ! Im a happy bubbly person too and my consultants always said - well you still have your smilly face . But remember behind every clowns face is a hundred tears .  The tears will come and probably when you least expect them .  Talk to your friends - mmm I must admit I can talk for Scotland !!!  Love  Ruby Rose xx
Posts.Title: Someone to talk to

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I am due Chemo no.6 tomorrow - THE FINAL ONE !!! Chemo no.5 was very tough with side effects . I have asked for my Dosetaxel ( had 6 ) to be reduced tomorrow. Because of the severity of my peripheral neuropathy - only now subsiding     and other side effects . i think what I have I now is fatigue - totally exhausted absolutely knackered !!! Can’t walk far at all! This morning a bit light headed - is this fatigue ? Feel ok otherwise . I will be phoning the hospital this morning to make sure my Dosetaxel is being reduced . Just wanted others opinion re fatigue - if I sit and watch tv or do my jigsaw I’m fine . Doing wee bits around the house - my elder son who left Home 17 years ago is returning home to live with us !!!! He is off to Uni to study MSc Adult Nursing - huge step for him having left a very senior position and extremely well paid one - but one he said wasn’t making him happy - so credit to him ! Fortunately I still have my late mums house, where he is storing his belongings , also we are waiting to see who goes to live there first him or US lol!!  Thankfully my husband is great and getting his old room in order . Fun times and my sons support will be great , especially for his dad . So I’m not doing much .  So if anyone can confirm what is fatigue that would be great.  Also  eyesight wee bit effected too!?  Excited , elated and wee bit worried re side effects after final chemo but hey ho I’ll get there. love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Peterawake  I know it’s so hard to receive less treatment that we think we need , I had chemo shortened and herceptin reduced too . I found speaking to the Macmillan nurses in this site really good , they put all arguments  for and against and advise you appropriately.  Remember chemotherapy is a HUGE cocktail and not without risks . Chemo cures but it can also kill.  Nowadays the medics look at the whole picture of treatment and life after treatment with the emphasis being on quality of life .  I have been left with side effects that could be permanent , if I had received my full chemo I might have been left not being able to walk and if I had received my full Herceptin I might have had permanent heart damage due to a pre existinsting heart murmur . I almost begged for more but they refused .  After speaking the the Macmillan nurse I have accepted their decision, I still worry but getting on with life .  Keep asking till you accept their decision, it’s your life .  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Worried again!

Posts.Content: Hi NiceCuppa yes chemo makes your skin super photosensitive! You MUST wear factor 50 sun block , plus a hat . I never sat  in direct sunshine during treatment and up to  a month after . Just get used to showering and applying sun screen every day . One evening a neighbour visited me but wouldn’t come into the house as she had a cold , we stood chatting in the garden at 8 o’clock in the evening for only 10 minutes ( no sunscreen as showered and in pjs ) well I came out in a red rash ! That’s how sensitive your skin will be .  So HAT , SUNBLOCK, and LOOSE CLOTHES. You will be fine , pale and interesting remember too much unprotected sunbathing  is not good for anyone  .  Personally I bought new furniture and blinds for my wee summerhouse , lady Year was a scorcher !  Take care  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: The Sun

Posts.Content: Hi sorry I’m not in Glasgow , I’m in Dundee , I just went to nearest , took a friend tried on wigs and laid one aside . Went back a few days later alone and got a completely different one that I felt happiest in . I liked the staff and I liked the selection and that was it . I thought I would answer your question to move you up the page .  Yes it’s a good idea to wear your wig before you need it , then you will see that NO ONE. Stares at you , then when / if you loose your hair you won’t be so self conscious.  Wishing you well  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: WIG shopping

Posts.Content: Hi maggiemee  Well I phoned and NO MORE CHEMO ! They say it’s hi dangerous as I could be left with no feeling in my feet , it wasn’t just my fingertips and toes , it was my whole feet for about 10 days . If it was permanent I would be disabled - shat I have just now I can live with but hopefully they will improve even a little . I go tomorrow for my last herceptin- only getting 6 due to heart murmur and I’m at s higher risk if heart failure !!  Upset that my body has let me down big time but it did that the moment it decided to host cancer !!  I see my oncologist at the find of August to see what next delight they have planned for me .  Going to have a wee prosecco when our son arrives home over the weekend . Wiltshire to Angus 8 to 10 hr drive !  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Rolybun, i bought sports bras from Tesco /Asda - inexpensive , I also bought bra expanders and used them with the bra as makes them more comfy . You can buy extenderson amazon - just google “bra extenders “ you could maybe use with your current bras , just make sure if your bra has 2 hooks you buy extenders with 2 hooks .  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Post op bras

Posts.Content: You will be fine as long as you wear plenty sun block and reapply as needed . Be gentle on yourself - you might just need to walk ! Don’t push it ! Get well first - gently does it  xxx
Posts.Title: The Sun

Posts.Content: Hi ask123, i get that now - I get no.5 of 6 Chemo tomorrow . People say I look amazing and I thank them and say that I try very hard . I also say yes thankyou I never come out when I’m in pain and feeling really bad ! Someone I know and whom I thought knew about my cancer , cane to my table and I asked his she was and she said - well I’m ill  realy ilI have an UTI and it’s making me ill , well I said I can beat you there - I have Breast cancer !!! I said before I thought !!! Well I think she wanted the ground to open up and swallow her !!! She said oh well I’m not ill then am I . Poor woman !!! I will phone her .  i have also said to friends that on bad days it’s lovely to have friends pop in or take me out for a cuppa - I can’t drive if I have streaming eyes . Some people listen ,the good ones arrange something there and then , or I know they will message and visit .  You just need to tell them , before BC I could have been guilty of the - just phone and I’ll visit routine . No you just visit even for 15 minutes .  Take care , my hubby going through rough time , worried about me all the time , but we have nasty exchanges ! Friends husband took him out for a couple of hours to chat. Sons phoned too , so while I’m in chemo he’s going to Maggies to talk and maybe arrange counselling. The boys said he had to do it even for them . They live in England and Wales and we are in Scotland ! Men not good about opening up . We all need time with friends .  Hugs  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: How are you?

Posts.Content: Hi London Lass  I don’t think  I posted much on the Awake thread , but you all looked like you were having fun and I could have joined in at anytime .  I’ve had a hard few weeks , mainly due to super irrational fears on my part . Think that’s what’s happened with the thread , totally irrational but only because of cancer mucking up our thoughts . All very sad .  I’m having a meeting with my oncologist today ( asked for by me ) and the before cancer person in me knows I’m being an over reactive stupid bitch makeing life hell for all my loved ones . But the Cancer me thinks I’m being totally short treated , although I do have at least 5 valid questions to ask .The Cancer me feels old ,small,and useless , I’m going to wash my hair ( dosetaxel only chemo- never known anyone else with this regime  ) so still have my hair ! Although in the colour and style my late mother would never have worn ! I am going to do my nails and try and Power Dress for my appointment as the last time I asked if something would happen I was told in no uncertain terms NO IT HAS BEEN DECIDED ! I was in hospital at the time - much to my shame and disappointment- time on my hands and grieving for my mum ( it actualy took a couple of months to hit me ) so I was at rock  bottom. This week got injection to boost my white blood cells but I have had a lot of pain and to my shame found it hard to cope , also mega constipation - more pain and bleeding . So hard to eat well when I can taste anything . So it’s going to be an interesting day , today !  Maybe they will release the awake thread to start afresh and even more fun for participants and folk like me reading and laughing .  The thought of meeting this highly educated oncologist today and mentioning pain and constipation is starting my irrational fears again . I’m 62 but next to this usually lovely young woman , I feel 100 - as if I’ll ever be 100   lol !   Hope they get the thread up again or start a new one - call it “ in the wee sma hours “ . Sorry for your loss of your friend , I think we feel it more in our situation .  Hugs Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: hi ladies  had my meeting and all questions asked were answered and more, must learn not to have melt downs !!! Feel so much happier and ready to get on with life . I was told I can phone i Can phone anytime . Came home with big bag of meds to make life more comfortable !  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Hi Sizzles , I was due to get 6 chemo  of Dosetaxel but only managed 5 . They wouldn’t give me the 6th as the peripheral neuropathy was quite bad , my last chemo was on the 6th July . My fingers and feet are gettting better but I might be left with life long differences . The tops of my fingers are bad but I did manage to sew  a hem up but my finger tips were painful . My feet vary from day to day , my toes always feel like I am walking on sandpaper .i often have to take my husbands hand or a friends arm when out walking  I need to get my toe  nailes trimmed and filed at the beautician ( I cant feel them to cut them myself ) - fortunately I am in a position to get a file and polish every three weeks , also get my finger nails done too as they have been effected too even though I got them painted black before every chemo .not lost any though. I attended a meeting at our Maggies centre and there were people - men and women , who had life changing effects from peripheral neuropathy.  So it’s a balancing act between trying to rid our bodies of cancer without disabling us with side effects .  Apart from the peripheral neuropathy, I also have chemo brain , which effects my short term memory, plus I need glasses now . Hopefully all will improve BUT I am so glad that I didn’t get the last chemo . They assured me it wouldn’t effect the outcome .  I can manage the side effects I have but who knows if I had gotten the 6th .  Of course it prays on my mind , I also could only get 6 Herceptin injections as opposed to the recommended 9 or 18 , but after lots of doubt on my mind I have accepted my oncologists decision. I have a pre existing heart murmur- nothing to worry about unless you take medicine that can harm the heart - and it did - but will heal itself . But could have ended in heart failure if I had had the planned 18.  Dont be afraid to ask questions and keep asking until you feel you can accept their decision. Phone the MacMillan nurses on the number on this site - I did - they are brilliant and put everything into layman’s terms and put across the oncologists point of view etc . So please phone them .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Taxol (Neuropathy)

Posts.Content: hi ladies  had my meeting and all questions asked were answered and more, must learn not to have melt downs !!! Feel so much happier and ready to get on with life . I was told I can phone i Can phone anytime . Came home with big bag of meds to make life more comfortable !  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Hi Ruby Rose here , no pain honestly - it’s more discomfort , paracetamol plus occasionally codein . I was 7 days in hospital . i was just about back to normal at 6 weeks then it was chemo for me ! I had a tough time as my mum died two days before my first chemo , but I managed all her arrangements and funeral , I was very tired but I did it , I was her carer for years and wanted to continue to do so to the very last for her .  You cant drive for 6 weeks but that is normal and due to me having DIEP , which is abdominal surgery .  My hospital had a specialist reconstruction nurse and she was and still is a wonderful knowledgeable  person , a very seniot nurse .  I can still phone her .  As your consultant quoted 5 hours I don’t think it will be DIEP. I would phone your BCN and ask her and ask about a specialist nurse who can give you all the ins and outs .  Really it’s all to do with which kind of reconstruction you are offered. Told I might not need chemo but I did to get any cancer cells that may have gonecwalk about . No radiotherapy for be though .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Hi ,  i had left mastectomy with immediate DIEP reconstruction . If I didn’t get immediate I doubt I could have faced it at a later day but lots of ladies do . My plastic surgeon decided on the DIEP based on where I had available fat on my body - that’s a laugh as practice nurse always said I was obese , but plastic surgeon said I had a very good body but only enough fat on my tummy , I had two up and down c sections but she still managed - very successfully . I was in surgery from 8.30am back on my side room at 10.15 pm - a long time but I was none the wiser. My operation and reconstruction has been a huge success and text book . I started chemo 6  weeks later . I have no regrets what so ever .  Good luck with your decision . Glad mine were all made for me with positive , caring attitudes . i could have declined of course , it’s scarey .  Love  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Hi ,  haur loss isn’t high on my concerns ( but I’m maybe kidding myself)  im more worried about side effects . Did you find the hair loss lmore upsetting than side effects .  Not started yet but def in the cards .  Just curiouds  love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Coming to terms with hair loss.

Posts.Content: Hi Welshie007 my up and down C sections are 36 and 39 years old but they have gone now , I had single mastectomy with immediate DIEP reconstruction , All went well and my new breast is amazing .No problems at all.  I did get a scan to check the blood vessels in my tummy. All ok.  Good luck  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Hi  When in hospital recently , my oncologist visited and I asked her “ after my 6 x Docetaxel and 6 x Herceptin, would I get a heart scan ? If my heart was ok ( apart from my murmur) would I get more Herceptin?”  No was the reply - it has been decided ! Quite sharp too. Told if my heart got damaged then they might not be able to fix it . I am prepared to pay for scans - well I have my pension pot that I can’t spend and looks like  I never will! Worked and saved hard and at 62 ! ?? Why did they bother ? I’m half way through and I was getting on great but disappointed that I was admitted to hospital with high temp and low white cell count. I have to get an injection 2 days after my next chemo to help keep my white blood count up. I have also developed peripheral nueropathy on the very tops of my fingers and toes.  Is Chemo worth it ? I’m loosing a year from my life and looks like I might not get it back. They say they got all the cancer when I had my MX and only three nodes were infected but they took them all. It’s a bit like fixing one thing then it goes wrong and they try that and fix the fix   and it escalates . Sorry I just feel so down - how can oncologist say 6 will be fine when all studies say 18 Herceptin , I was even told that there are studies that say 3 is enough and I’m getting 6 , so I’m getting extra . I found a study saying 9 but not 3 or 6 .  Suppose I could spend my pension pot on a second opinion but in Scotland that would be frowned at.  A very wilted  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Anyone got a heart murmur ( before BC ) and having treatment changed...

Posts.Content: Hi ,  JoDec , ronstar and  Tettie  I phoned my 38 year old son and told him my fears . My main question is :- if my oncologist  thinks my heart  is as bad as she says it is , not getting anymore than 6 Herceptin, then why am not not seeing a cardiologist and why is she not following NICE recommendations ( not law ) and booking a heart scan at the recommended 3 months , which is next week?!  My murmur was discovered and discounted about 10 years ago after a year of heart tests that in the end were put down to the menopaus - I was in theatre and cardiologist did his last test and said - right your fine , your hearts fine , now go and book your holiday . He had always suspected that my symptoms were due to the menopaus !  Am I too old at 62? Have they run out of money ? i telephoned  the Macmillan help  line yesterday and nurse has advised me to tell her secretary how I feel - my son will do this for me as he has medical experience and knows the jargon. He phoned today and he spoke to someone covering for her , who was very nice and agreed with what the Macmillan nurse said - that my oncologist will be upset to discover how upset I am. He will phone again tomorrow .  Also my oncologist keeps referring to studies but doesn’t tell me the names of these studies , then how can I read up on them myself .  My son says I shouldn’t have to go private as what i am asking for is basic care .  Just wish he had spoken to her secretary today , I’m on edge .  Thanks for being there for me  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Anyone got a heart murmur ( before BC ) and having treatment changed...

Posts.Content: Hi Shoppin_snowball  i always found gentle massage with e45 emollient wash was very good , found it easier when in the warm shower , just gentle circular movements , round breast and underarm . Macmillan have exercise and also massage videos on UTube .  I found them very helpful . Like part of a class etc .  Take care  love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Hard reconstruction tips

Posts.Content: Hi Megzxxx I’ve not had this experience but I’m just trying to put your mind at ease until someone else comes along  I had a mastectomy with immediate reconstruction ,  I had to wait 6 weeks until I was fully healed before I could start chemo - some people can take longer to heal  . Sadly 2 days before my first chemo my mum died , I went ahead with my chemo BUT I was told I could put the chemo off for a few weeks and it wouldn’t effect my treatment . This would have brought me up to where your mother is now .  I hope you can find some comfort in this . Although I know your mother will just want to get on with the treatment , everything does get better when we are actively fighting cancer with treatment .  Wishing you both well for the future  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Worried Sick Delay in starting Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi JoDec Appointment to see my oncologist next week, I have tagged you in another thread “ Anyone who is gett8ng Herceptin but not getting the full 18 injections”  Interesting post by bananagirl .  I’m tired tonight as got bloods done first thing, then Nails painted black then sparkly pink ! Then went to my late mums flat and sorted through more of her clothes and shed  buckets of tears but very therapeutic. I cried , talked to her and was angry with her, I washed her living room window and down fell a bonnie white feather . Bloods weren’t back when nurse called for pre chemo assessment - ugh , but hopefully all ok , if I don’t hear by lunch time tomorrow , all will go ahead on Friday . Keep you informed how next week goes. Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Anyone got a heart murmur ( before BC ) and having treatment changed...

Posts.Content: Hi KEM63 i looked on utube for massage techniques , you need to use your own discression  . Try Macmillan search first . When I was doing my exercises  I found it helpful to “join a class” ffollowing the class , I  my exercises  written down but once I seen others doing them it was easier .  So if you know what you are supposed to do then have a look and see if someone has posted people doing the massage . Just type in the search box what you want and see what comes up . Ignore any rubbish !!  I found easy exercises to do when I had congestion in my arm on the operated side . Ok knowing what to do but seeing someone doing it is better.  Good luck  Ruby Rose
