Posts.Content: Hi All, I will phone hospital tomorrow if need be . The soles of my feet are very hot and sore , anyone got on tips for some relief . Thankfully no blistering or broken skin . Thanks Ruby Rose  My face looks better when I smile - so smile it is !
Posts.Title: Hot and sore soles of feet

Posts.Content: Good morning Dreamthief ,  yes im on Dosetaxel x 6 , No5 Chemo due on Friday , I get my phone consultation on Wednesday . I do have peripheral  neuropathy slightly on fingers and toes which I reported last chemo , not interfering with daily activities . I was just wondering if anyone had MAGIC cream or potions !!! Wish . I suffered badly last couple of days with watery eyes but yesterday went to boots and was handed dry eye drops and yes magic instant relief , told although my eyes were watery ,  my tears wouldn’t have been good quality , so suggested the drops for dry eyes . Maybe pop in today and see if they have any cheap and magic help for my feet ! I’m going to the sea side with friends today , so I’ll take my water shoes and go paddling !! nothing like a walk in the North Sea to reinvigorate one !!  i read your attachments , interesting about ice packs on my feet while having chemo but I’m wearing a cold cap ( still gave 90% of my hair )so might be a bit too chilly !!! I’ll take with me though and see how I get on . I’m up fior  trying anything - within reason . Also good to read to apply cream and not massage .  Thanks  for your help  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Hot and sore soles of feet

Posts.Content: Hi Carmol i got red cheeks with steroids .  Have you been wearing factor 50 sun cream at all times ? Plus you should be wearing a hat in the sun . Your skin is super sensitive to sun while getting Chemo .  I got zapped by the sun while chatting to a neighbour over the garden fence at 8 at night !! Bright red in morning !!  Hope this helps  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Red cheeks

Posts.Content: Hi Zaf37 Cheapest way would be to buy bra extenders , you can buy on amazon , but I got mine in a local sewing shop and also found out my bra shop sells them too , quick and easy to fit . Some nights is extent with 2,  Hope this helps Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Advice on bras

Posts.Content: DearLondonmumof2 Sorry to say there is nothing “normal” in this journey . I would think one appointment will be with your Breast surgeon , then the other could be for one of many reasons . If you are having reconstruction in the future - it could be with plastic surgeon . You may have options of radiotherapy or chemotherapy, or you could be getting tablets so could be with Oncologist . You don’t have too long to wait and I know that any wait is too long but look after yourself and all will become clear . An oncology appointment could also be to explain everything and that you don’t need any further treatment .  Hugs love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Two appointments now on Wednesday and Thursday for results?

Posts.Content: Hi Kath50 yes my Diep scar gets s bit angry plus my new boob gets lumpy/ hard feeling like I was due a period ( not had that for years !) but soon settles .  I am only on Docetaxel and have had 2 so 4 more  to go - ooh what delights are in store I wonder .    I manage the muscle ache with paracetamol and ibuprofen on bad days ( so far )  love Ruby Rose. X
Posts.Title: Docetaxel Face Rash

Posts.Content: Hi , it’s when you get visits from “friends” the first time they hear you have cancer - out it comes everyone they know who had cancer and the ones that died plus all their problems .  Mind you we were out with good friends and one said “well how are you enjoying your retirement Billy?”  My husbsnd just looked at me and we nearly laughed - he said “it would have been great if I hadn’t brought it forward a wee bit to help Ruby through her cancer fight “ my poor friend looked at us in horout when she realised what she had asked !! You have to laugh ! It’s so unbelievable!
Posts.Title: Just need a rant

Posts.Content: Hi Janeydoll , due 3rd Docetaxel next Friday , not had a rash , I would phone as they maybe able to give you meds .  Ruby Rose x

Posts.Content: Hi GRANNY59   I got my recall letter today !  Very cleverly worded as to make us think it’s a revue whereas we know it was actioned  because of a whistle blower . Letter says arrangements will be made for me to see an oncologist to discuss my treatment .  Got my 1st annual mammogram last week and told I would get my results in 6 weeks !!! Wonder how long I will need to wait to see an oncologist !!  Our  time is so very precious to us and we could do without the worry and waiting .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: NHS Tayside Breast cancer on BBC

Posts.Content: Hi Breasty-besty def worth getting your eyes tested . My eyes were effected by chemo and I now need glasses all the time , not just for reading as before . I got them tested 3 months after chemo finished and again a couple of weeks ago as sight was “weird” and they have changed again , one eye worse and one eye better . Optician said no wonder I felt “wonky”!!  Worth  a try  and because you have had treatment you don’t have to wait 2 years between tests . You get as many as required . ( in Scotland anyway)  take care  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: CT scan for brain mets

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone , I’m sure I will be ok but it would have been better to have been told the whole story and maybe given choices , plus I could maybe have been given the weekly chemo that was gentler and would have enabled me to finish the full course .  Also when I asked questions one reply started with  “I take exception to you questioning my treatment plan for you”.  It was more to do with my reduced Herceptin than chemo but it’s MY life and I can ask questions if I want to .  My oncologist was nice and I was told by staff that she always put the safety of her patients first re side effects etc BUT I heard quite a lot about her not liking to be questioned .!  So even if that issue with her inability to take questioning more of a compliment of patients trusting her than looking at it as if We questioning her ability. I would see this enquiry/follow up as a positive step . It’s not about one person but the whole oncology department . If any of you want to read the full HIS report , it does make for interesting reading . I take comfort in that they say that there was no evidence if cost cutting .  http://www.healthcareimprovementscotland.org/our_work/governance_and_assurance/programme_resources/nhs_tayside_breast_cancer.aspx Bit fed up that cancer issues are eating into my life , when I want to get on with living . love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: NHS Tayside Breast cancer on BBC

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone  My meeting went well and turns out I shouldn’t have been recalled as due to my heart murmur I had a completely different chemo to the one in question . Was good though as I had some questions and I have a sore hip . Oncologist will recall me in a month or so and give me a full Mot , bloods and X-ray but she says she suspects arthritis. But she says after what I have been through she wants to put my mind at ease - so I’m happy . . Day after my meeting my Mammogram result came  through - ALL CLEAR. ! New Passport ordered as my photo had mega changed and last holiday was told I should change it ,just in case ! I only had a year remaining , so new one applied for . Then it will be holidays !  Off to York this weekend and no need for a passport ! Meeting family so excited !  Hope you are all doing well and thank you for the good wishes .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: NHS Tayside Breast cancer on BBC

Posts.Content: Hi Devon Dumpling ,  I too get sick , terrifies me , when I had my mastectomyand immediate reconstruction  I was petrified facing the 10 hours operation and being sick , my son told the aneathatist and I was prescribed a 5 day slow release anti sickness pill. Sorry I can’t remember the name . I also got this pill before every chemo and was never sick . Please phone your team and ask for something like that .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: So anxious....

Posts.Content: Hi Sammystaff I didn’t get EC , my regime is Dosetaxel and Herceptin . I have had 3 so far , no fatigue , I get a 5 day slow release anti sickness tablet every time. You could maybe explain about the wedding and ask if it’s possible for you to get something like that. Yes flu symtens but only requiring paracetamol . I do however get tummy cramps and like to be near a toilet but no real problems.  Unfortunately I am in hospital having had a raised temperature. But staff say that’s a blip .  The first of dosetaxel didn’t give me any side effects for 6 days .  Mention the wedding to your team and I’m sure they will try their best to help. A neighbour across the road for me had FEC-T and she was bedded sleeping for 2 weeks after chemo ( her curtains were closed and she also told me ) but with T she has been out and about but I haven’t spoke to her. Her curtains always open . So hopefully that will be you . Love  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Docetaxel, pertuzumab, trastuzumab

Posts.Content: Hi Supermom, keep it in your mouth and run it round your mouth , think it’s 5 minutes, do not swallow , spit it out . I used to use it in the shower , morning and night , that way not so laborious - multi tasking . It did help my mouth . Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Nystan

Posts.Content: Hi Lala1982 Hope you are drinking lots , I know water tastes yuck but if you suck frozen pineapple chunks then drink ,it’s actualy very pleasant . But watch if your mouth is too sore , but drink drink drink - honest get rid of all the poisons .  Have you difflam mouth wash ? Get it from your hospital and use as prescribed or dilute , I was told to use twice a day , diluted , every day and if need be , full strength 4 times a day or as prescribed , bottle says every 1.5 hours for pain if need be - just gargle and spit out.  I also got meds for mouth ulcers after last chemo but with using the difflam I have only little mouth ulcers , this time , and not painful.  Bottom !!! Lol - always wash your bottom with water after each movement if possible then dry and apply nappy cream and I also got boots own hemorroid cream ( just in case ) - my bottom and skin have survived !!!  You should also get meds for heartburn from your team.  So phone your team as soon as you can and get medication , if too far to go to hospital they may ask you to go to your own gp or they can email prescriptions to a pharmacy . Always best to consult your team.  They are here to look after you .  Can’t help with white blood cell injection ( ooo the delights )  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sunny 123 , make sure you take paracetamol 30 minutes before cold cap and have a hot cuppa at the ready for when they plug you in - makes all the difference . I took in my own paracetamol and asked team when to take them , also took a flask but my nurse had it ready for me - she insisted the cuppa would make cold cap ok and it did . I also take in lots of cosy fleece blankets .  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Tibu 315 Don’t make light of a virus - a virus can kill !!  I once apologised to the doctor for a house call , he came and said it’s a virus - when I apologised  , he said never apologise , a virus can make us very very ill and they can kill . He said I was very poorly and was sorry he couldn’t give me anything but advice to rest rest rest !!  So take care and rest rest rest  Ruby Rose xxx
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi LeoLady  Get your NHS one ! Mine is magic even better than my own hair , I just popped into a wig shop on spec and lady let me try on and I put one aside , got Hospital to do their paperwork. Went back tried it on again and wasn’t so sure . I eventually chose a different one . I put it in with minimal fuss , it’s lighter than my dyed hair but I thought that better as when my own hair is back as normal , it will be white !! I am using the cold cap and might not loose it all . I wore it after chemo yesterday as cold cap leaves your hair mega flat and you can’t comb for a while . Everyone said it looked great . I felt great !  Go for it . But not on line - you need to try on.  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Sunny123 ,  I drink 3 LITRES of water on first 3 days . I asked for better anti sickness pills as I didn’t feel I could cope with sickness and I got a tiny pill before  my chemo , don’t know name but it is a 5 day slow release anti sickness , and it works after the 5!days I take the odd anti sickness tablet , when I feel yucky . I also take paracetamol for pain , sometime ibuprofen but make sure you eat before or with ibuprofen  Hope you feel better soon .  Love  Ruby Rose   I’m getting on fine xxx
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah Freeze pineapple pieces - fresh or tinned - put in ice cube tray and add a cocktail stick . Freeze .  Then munch on a couple and drink water , it will taste ok . Repeat ! Aim for 3 ltrs in 24 hours . This washeds all the horribleness away .    Try same before eating .  Good luck Lorna  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Yve1362 I had 3 infected lymph nodes and they removed 32.  I had my left mastectomy with immediate DIEP reconstruction in March 18. My operation was text book . I was in hospital 7 days , no real pain , mainly discomfort , I took paracetamol and occasionally codein. When I came home I had no drains or anything.  First night home I slept sitting up on our recliner which was very comfortable.  The order of the day when you get home is rest.  I must admit when I got home I covered all the mirrors , I asked a district nurse from my doctors practice to call in and check  my wounds which she did twice. I came out the shower one morning and said to my husband “Well I suppose you want a look “ he said yes , I threw open the towel and silence !!! I peaked through shut eyes and he was standing there in amazement , he said it’s really amazing , fantastic . A few days later I looked - through tears ( it’s a very emotional time) and I was pleasantly surprised . Every medical professional who has had to check me , all say my new breast is perfect. I have no difference between bra cups , at first there was a little difference but once settled they are equal .  You need to do your exercises , Macmillan have some on utube too. I also asked my gp for physio , told that’s not usual but I wanted to be reassured that I was doing them correctly , physiotherapist was lovely and kept me on the right track and I only seen  her the once .     You will need plenty of moisturing cream - at first I used E45 then Aveena , it’s important to moisturise and massage your breast and tummy . E45 emoliant bath is lovely to massage while in the bath. Ok your tummy and breast will be numb but mine is getting more feeling , don’t think it will ever be normal but hey ho! I’m not to sure of my tummy button ! Hubby cleaned it for me too ! It looks ok but different to my old one . I have a lovely flat tummy !  I now have lovely new feminine bras but non wired . I like wearing a top I have with a wee peak hole at the cleavage and I look good !!! Yes I do !  Be warned on the day before my operation i had a MEGA meltdown !! I wasn’t going , i was cancelling etc etc . But I went to hospital , yes petrified and the staff picked up on that . The anaesthetist came round and I told her I was frightened of being sick and she changed the cocktail and I had no sickness . I was very well taken care of by everyone . Day 2, I couldn’t stop crying but my plastic surgeon said she wouldn’t expect anything else , due to the amount of medication I had had the day of the operation . She was the voice of reason.  I’ve had it tough as my mum died 5 weeks later and 2 days before my first chemo .( I was her carer) But I’m getting there , chemo going well , I wear the cold cap Bd still got my hair , I’ve been admitted once due to high temp. I have 2 more chemo to get . I had my Plastic surgeon check up on Monday and all well and “whow” used again re my breast .  I would honestly say the fear and emotional pain is the biggest hurdle on this journey .  I wish you well and please ask any questions.  Love and hugs  Ruby Rose 1362
Posts.Title: reconstruction with abdominal fap

Posts.Content: Hi Ali owl, j i am 62 , and you still in early days , plastic surgeons are perfectionists and I was told they won’t consider any “tweaks” until after chemo, I get a 6 month check up and they will look again then , my breast is great but I have a couple of wee notches either end of tummy scar , if they don’t bother me I will leave alone but we will see in 3 months time .  chemo also has an effect on our wounds - very weird - one day I feel soft and normal then a couple of days later I feel as though  have a brick for a breast but it’s still soft !!! Told it’s normal . Powerfull stuff chemo ! That’s why they need your wounds to be well healed before starting chemo .  I started chemo 10 days after my 1st oncology appointment . When my mum died they said I could postpone for 2 weeks and it wouldn’t effect my results. I went ahead , it was hard but I was so busy organising her funeral to worry about the chemo , chemo was kind to me . ( that’s time Lol!)  its been ok . Don’t just massage your wounds , massage your full breast , gently .  Thank you for your kind wishes . I hope you get your oncology appointment soon. You could phone your  BCN and chase it on .  Love Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: reconstruction with abdominal fap

Posts.Content: Hi Lou1234, just read your profile , you have enough to worry about with the cancer battle without money worries . I know you want to be independent but sometime we just have to accept help on the understanding that you will return that help in the decades to follow .  My son of 39 moved back home to go to uni and we are keeping him , our choice , he has accepted this graciously. Maybe too graciously I’m sure someone will be along soon to point you in the financial help direction or you could phone the Macmillan helpline on here and I’m sure they will help . Also citizens advice can help , they also have them at Maggies , if you have one near you,  then pop in, they are lovely and NOT full of sick people . Full of everyday folk trying to get the best from life . Plus you can register for the Look good feel good session where you get lots of lovely cosmetics and treats .  Keep in touch on here , wonderful people with lots of knowledge to help you . Love Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: Hi ,  Expected to meet with my oncologist today but only got her registrar . Told that my curative treatment was over but they don’t commit to me being cured - there’s a surprise .! Don’t see oncology again , should feel happy but don’t .  Then he says I’m being prescribed RISEDRONATE . Not convinced of the benefits , I’m not on anything else . Anyone else just getting this?  ( exclude the meds needed to control its side effects!) confused and feeling dumped ! Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Risendronate

Posts.Content: Hi Yve 1362 i am getting  Dosetaxel and my oncologist said it had a good success rate of keeping hair , using the cold cap . I take paracetamol half an hour before they put the cap on me , I have a couple of fleece  blankets . My husband makes me a flask of hot coffee which is great to hold  and sip . After ten minutes the cold eases . Another lady I know ( chemo buddy aged 73!)with other cancers ,is using the cold cap too and getting on fine. I wear my wig after the cold cap as your hair is very flat . I love my  wig , it’s a free one from NHS in Scotland . Looks better than my own hair !! Lady at Maggies said when I was starting that even if I lost  half my hair , I would only have half to grow after !!  See what your oncologist says . It’s only a tiny layer that gets the cold . Not thing like a thought it was going to be .  Love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: reconstruction with abdominal fap

Posts.Content: Hi , I can confirm that the job centre are able to do this , they scan and email the docs and I also asked for a copy for my records and that wasn’t a problem . As I am employed but on long term sickness , they need my sickline from doctor and they also copy that for me and my employer as they keep originals .  Ruby  Rose x
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: Hi  spoke to nurse and visited Maggies Centre , now happy , wait and see Dentist in the morning .  Good to chat , discuss and get rid of the doubts .  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Risendronate

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56,  yes I got son looking through Internet and found papers - supporting this drug - thank goodness - awful that we have to find our own reassurance . It’s just the thought of taking a drug then having take other drugs to counteract the side effects of the first drug - main one being heart burn - ok I could be lucky and not get any,  bye the way a side effect of omeprzole is bone thinning ! So itoes round in a circle i also signed up to take part in the add aspirin trial ,( seen research nurse before oncology registrar )  but warned about heartburn too, might give it a miss as the thought of 5 years taking a placebo is a bit worrying , they give either a placebo or one of two strengths of aspirin . Seems a long  time at my age although reassuring that they think I will still be here at the end of 5 years !!  Im really in a pity mood tonight as he wasn’t bothered about my peripheral neuropathy in my feet and hands - “ might improve , might not ah but shouldn’t get worse “ gee thanks for that .  Thank you very much for replying and I will try and give myself a shake in the morning .  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Risendronate

Posts.Content: Hi mumofboys  definitely  instist on a referral , my BC was picked up at routine mammogram , I had no lump , what they seen on mammogram was early cancer,  I also had a tiny cancer that even MRI could not detect but as I had 3 infected lymph nodes they knew a cancer was present . They found it after my surgery during pathology tests.  No point in worrying about this - go and get referred , it’s your body and your life .  Wishing you well and hope I haven’t frightened you xx just write down all our comments and read them to the doctor . love  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: Can I ask you opinions?

Posts.Content: Good morning Dreamthief ,  i cant contact the oncologist as I have been told I will no longer see that department . Also a few months ago I questioned the fact that I was only getting 6 Herceptin and she didn’t take kindly to that  , she was very defensive and even my very placid husband got a shock at her manner . I now accept her decision due to my heart murmur and now see at 56% re MUGA scan , my heart isn’t too great . So if cancer doesn’t get me my heart will . Not seeing cardiologist though !??.  Im worried about my teeth and jaw with this drug but seeing my dentist tomorrow for X-rays . He’s very good and very knowledgeable. I trust him .  I have never had a scan to check for osteoporosis. Not been told about chews but I have bought vitamin D myself.  Dont know when or how I will get the prescription as letter being sent to my GP . But I don’t go to my GP and they dont know me . I did occasionally go to a doctor but she has retired. I usually phone for a sick line but expect I’ll have to visit to plead for one now . My work just said your 62 with cancer maybe you should retire !!! I’m hanging on as even if they don’t pay me I get £70 approx from gov .  My PN is manageable but I dont know if I should be walking through the pain or discomfort or what . Both my feet to my ankles and even my right knee were effected .thats why they stopped my chemo after no.5.  Now right foot to sole of heal but toes are worst , left foot is a lot better . Top third of fingers tingle and after doing things are painfull ,  oncologist not really interested as I suppose there is nothing they can do .  Technically im cancer free but the oncologist I seen yesterday was like a wee boy and a very wet squid - no enthusiasm at all.  I was looking forward to booking a holiday and I was told I could , I just feel I would be irresponsible and unfair to my husband ( who wants to bubble wrap me and stick me somewhere safe !) . i see the plastic surgeon next month and that’s it . Mammogram in March when it could all kick off again ! im down for the add aspirin trial , don’t know if I will do it now but only good thing about it , I would get ct scans etc  and continual monitoring even if I get the placebo.  Just hate being reminded every day by taking pills - never ever taken pills until now !  Suppose I just have to get on with it .  Highlight of my week - easy aqua aerobics! I feel normal there .  Thanks for replying and great to hear your other half is doing well.  Ruby Rose x

Posts.Content: Hi Violetsniff  Ooo to be a granny - but think I would have to knit a grandchild !!! Both sons still batchelors ! I live in hope ! My brother became a dad at 50 ! Suppose with men their biological clock doesn’t tick so fast !  I have two loving sons , I know friends who’s sons and daughters have had marriage breakups and the grand parents don’t get to see the grandchildren - so cruel and sad for everyone .  We get to live our lives and if we choose to have children but we only get them on loan as they become adults and live their own lives , which actually means - job well done ! As mine are strong capable men and independent. They still phone mum and dad - and one is back for 3 years at uni !!! just really want them to get partners , they have lots of friends .  We visited Sellafield once and they had  a family display about atoms etc . One display is a white haired granny atom ( bit like a big M&M ) sitting in  a rocking chair doing her knitting - that could be me !!i live in hope ! I now have the hair !!! Problem with me - I can give advise - though I do try to ZIP IT!!  To I take my own???  !!  ? Not always - sometimes I need to give myself a slap !!   But I do listen to others  .  Have a lovely day - I’m excited - it’s supposed to be windy and I want to line dry my sons bedding before he returns from visiting friends ! You can’t beat washing dried outside ! Ooo the exciting llife I live !!! love  Ruby Rose

Posts.Content: Hi,  to save my husband hearing me repeat what was happening to me I decided with his agreement to Tell family , friends and workmates via text email and messenger . I did tell my sons face to face on FaceTime first. So I write and tell them all what is happening , I just write one message and copy and paste to them all. So far it’s workingvand I haven’t forgotten anyone . My house is like a florists , I can go shopping and get a cuddle without having to discuss my cancer . I find it very therapeutic replying to messages which are usually spread out over a number of days . I’m still getting the full disgnosis . Might be another week till I get my treatment plan.  Take care Ruby Rose x

Posts.Content: Hi all day 1 of chemo went very smoothly - except I’m very red !! But I was like that before I went to hospital this morning !!!! been busy writing my mums eulogy just incase I get poorly !  Off to sleep now - temp perfectly normal , been drinking lots of water . So dare  say I’ll be up again soon. Will check temp again.  Thanks for caring and being there for me . I have Decided to cry at home and with close friends so that my headstone when I’m 88 won’t read “ she was a right greetin face!”  Night all  mums funeral is wednesday . Hope tax train rolls bye!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I’m having a melt down ! Don’t know if I can do this !! From what I can make out Docetaxel plus the herceptin equals Hell! The thought of being ill for the next 18 weeks fills me with dread . My poor family would be better off without me . Some ladies have been a member of this communty for years , how do you manage ?  I really don’t think I can do this , to knowingly inflict all this misery on family is so cruel . I have tried hard to be positive . I just can’t stop crying , my poor husband has gone to bed thinking I am watching soaps on catch up .  The fact that I can only get Herceptin for 6 over the 18 weeks instead of the usual year shows what a waste of time I am . I have a heart murmur . My 88 year old mother won’t speak to me now as I’m useless to her , even though I organise , and see to the payment of her carers , I’ve made up all their wages until end of August but she sees me as a failure .  Just having a melt down - I will allow them to poison me and make me ill , i Couldn’t hurt my sons by refusing treatment but I don’t know how I’ll get in the car for the 60 mile  round trip .  I keep offering my husband a divorce but he stays and honestly I couldn’t do without him . It’s such a waste of his life and he just retired too. No holidays for him now . Just misery . After 42 years this is how I repay him. This Chemo frightens me so much . Supposed to start on Friday 13th.  A very sad and frightened  Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Just get worse , I met an old friend at the breast clinic just as we had been recalled after our mammograms . She had her first chemo a week past Thursday and it was by choice as she was borderline . She died on Sunday . Need to do a post-mortem. But looks like sepsis . heart broken and in turmoil
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hello Everyone ,  Thankyou so much for all your caring words - well I made it to my mums funeral and I managed to stand in line and greet friends and family - no kisses though ! Everything went well and I’m pleased that I managed to do her proud . I can hear her saying “ your doing well” Now on day 6 of T and herceptin. Got meds for furry tongue, quite sore all over but just taking paracetamol. Went to hospital yesterday evening just to get my arm checked as a little lump had formed , hospital weren’t concerned but with todays plans , I felt I wanted it checked out. They were so nice to me and told me I was doing great and I came home .  Dare say I will crash and burn now but that’s ok as I got to take care of my mums final wishes and it was a lovely service . Now to get on with my LIFE. LIVE I WILL !  My Mum used to call me Gently Bentley and that’s how I will proceed .  Love to you all a very grateful  Ruby Rose  Lorna x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Good Morning Everyone , well we do have to be positive and it is a lovely day here in sunny Angus.  Well I join this discussion group as of Friday the 13th April . Fab date !!  Because I have found I have a heart murmur they have changed my chemo from the normal ( mmm funny word that ) I’m getting Docetaxel and at the same time getting Herceptin - every 3 weeks for 18 weeks.that will be it.  Anyone had this combination? The consultant told me the side effects of Docetaxel and then said as for The Herceptin they will overtaken by the Docetaxel - nice - not .  I know everyone is different but I’m expecting a rough time but what frightens me most is being sick as my tummy after the Diep surgery ( will be 5 and a half weeks from surgery) isn’t ready for the reaching I usually end up if I’m ill. I usually have to go to out of hours etc and get a jab to stop me being sick) I will tell them this at me pre-chemo appointment on the 11th . Anyone been prescribed stronger anti sickness , just so I know they are out there .  Hope everyone is bearing up.  Love  Ruby Rose x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Cathy , I have taken a screenshot of your post ( for me only )   Not good at medical names , my son told the anesthetist before my mastectomy and Diep , how sticky I was and petrified and she said she would tweet my cocktail! She did and no sickness . So I hope when I emphasis my fears that they might upgrade me ( never been upgraded on a flight lol) . But if they mention any of these names I can be reassured .  Getting my nails painted black ( normal polish ) and getting wee flowers on them the night before chemo - wee bit of pampering.  Thank you for your reply , we all need each other x  Lorna  Alias Ruby Rose xx

Posts.Content: Hi Lynn i have a heart murmur , originally I was to get FEC for 18 weeks and herceptin for a year but with the discovery of my heart murmur I have had that all changed . As oncologist said - no use fixing my cancer and breaking my heart .  I have read on here some Maggies on herceptin are now getting heart medication .  No FEC  either for same reason , now Docetaxel .  so Nothing to do with money just cocktail being taylored for me.  Take care Ruby Rose
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Violet25, Have you telephoned your plastic surgeons secretary ? You need to get back to your team. They wouldn’t want you suffering and they would see about physio.  Take care Ruby Rose xx
Posts.Title: Back spasms 9 weeks after DIEP

Posts.Content: My mum has died suddenly . Thank you everyone, had a good meeting for pre chemo assessment and all good but then I’ve been floored, my dear Mum died so suddenly but peacefully to night , while in respite . She was 88 and the end came after 24hrs of having a chest infection. Care Home staff in shock at the suddenness.  I have spoken to the chemo ward senior nurse , at first I thought I can’t start my chemo with this happening but Mum and I had planned and paid for her funeral a couple of years ago . So just really flowers to organise tomorrow and any loose ends to be tied up at undertakers. So I’m going ahead on Friday, I owe it to my husband and sons and I’m sure the chemo nurses will take care of me .  How many tears can one person cry ? How much heartache can one person take ? I must pull up my BIG pants and smile and greet the new dawn with strength.  A very very sad Ruby Rose

Posts.Title: How I feel

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut11, i have a heart murmur and because of this I couldn’t get FEC-T , plus the 18 Herceptin injections  . The plan changed to  6 x Dosetaxel but I only managed 5 as I became too poorly with side effects . 6 Herceptin injections - I questioned this and had an extra meeting to discuss with my oncologist, she said no I am not giving you anymore due to the danger to your heart - she said to me “ how would I like to be clear of cancer but in a wheel chair due to heart failure?” So I excepted that 6 was best - I had pushed for 9 injections but she wouldn’t budge and I’m grateful because the chemo and herceptin have damaged my heart but should heal itself and I am not on any medication for it .  I would have been delighted if I had been allowed the 9 . But I have been told that 6 is good . ( told there have been trials with 6 injections and results were favourable too)  I spoke too the Macmillan nurses on here , they are so knowledgeable and can explain things from different perspective.  Its a hard choice but I’m sure in a year there will be no choice it will be 9. Injections .  Love  Ruby Rose xx remember they don’t throw everything at us cancer fighters anymore - they take a balanced view as we are going to be here a long time and they look at the effect side effects have on our lives . The medics want us to have a high quality of life .
